entry.title: A Memory With The Safai Wala
entry.content:
However I still wanted to get rid of that evil money I had, so I saw a , went towards him and gave him that 20 INR bill which I was about to burn, while telling him the reason and the stupid act I was about to make !!!

Surprised after hearing the same saying from him which stopped me from doing a stupid act, I gave him another 20 INR bill, asked his name, shook his hands and left !!!

  • How there is some form of wisdom in every single person on this mother earth - How there is strength in united wisdom more than any wisdom of flawed individual humans - How our country has kept their morals and wisdom of so many thousands years of ancient history

So this one time my mom dad were fighting regarding money while we were travelling, same old shit and general struggles of middle class family.

So I told them am going for a walk for sometime and left their company/fight to take my mind off things.

Light a cigarette and think about the issue they were fighting on, however even after lighting cigarette I didn’t feel better.

So I came up with another solution lets burn the money I have in my wallet with fire.

Just I was about to do the above a thought crossed my mind, लक्ष्मी को कभी जलाया नहीं जाता!

So I stopped before executing my stupidity !!!

However I still wanted to get rid of that evil money I had, so I saw a सफाई वाला, went towards him and gave him that 20 INR bill which I was about to burn, while telling him the reason and the stupid act I was about to make !!!

The first thing he said after receiving and listening to me in a very happy manner, लक्ष्मी को कभी जलाया थोड़े नहीं जाता हैं, हमारे काम आ जाएगा, इस रुपैया की जरूरत हमें आपसे ज़्यादा हैं !!!

Surprised after hearing the same saying from him which stopped me from doing a stupid act, I gave him another 20 INR bill, asked his name, shook his hands and left !!!

I felt not just good but great after that !!! :) :)

While going back to my mom and dad I reflected on these facts :-

  • How there is a bigger wisdom in the crowd
  • How education doesn’t make you the most intelligent person in any room
  • How there is some form of wisdom in every single person on this mother earth
  • How there is strength in united wisdom more than any wisdom of flawed individual humans
  • How our country has kept their morals and wisdom of so many thousands years of ancient history
  • How even after being looted out of our resources there is still that same old wisdom present in each and every Indian
  • How good karma should be the ultimate destiny and journey for every person, country rather than anything else

Enough of how and now :P Lets celebrate happiness this awesome Deepawali !!!

entry.title: The Lost And Found Case Of The Sanjeevani Booti
entry.content:
While enquiring more about it, he got to know that the plant which he was selling with a different name is actually Sanjeevani Booti.

He had been selling it for the past 7 years, and since nobody used to believe him that its Sanjeevi Booti, he stopped telling the real name of this plant.

Real story

Those who follow Hinduism must already have heard of metaphysical importance behind folklore of Sanjeevani Booti.

Its a medicinal herb used by Ram Ji to save Lakshman Ji which was very bravely brought by Hanuman Ji (whole mountain).

While our reporter was going through the busy streets of Nehru Place, he found a guy selling a very curious plant.

The plant was dead and dry but when you dip it inside water for a few days all the dead leaves and roots regain their life without any exception.

You might be thinking this happens to every plant through photosynthesis, but there is a big difference when each leaf regains their life against new leaves being created by other kinds of similar plant.

While enquiring more about it, he got to know that the plant which he was selling with a different name is actually Sanjeevani Booti.

He had been selling it for the past 7 years, and since nobody used to believe him that it's Sanjeevi Booti, he stopped telling the real name of this plant.
It can be verified from google image search results that what he was saying is actually entirely accurate.

Like how its written in the folklore of Hinduism the plant has almost every imagined medical benefit to your body provided you eat its green leaves.

Our reporter took a photo of the guy selling Sanjeevani Boots inside Nehru Place of New Delhi.

Interested Audience can buy it at a meager rate of 20 INR/piece or 50 INR/ 3 pieces.

Our reporter then gave the Sanjeevani Booti to the guy who was being dead…. Magic happened, and he is alive again. 😛

Those who don’t look for magic will never find it.

entry.title: What Not Having A Life Is?
entry.content:
Sometimes having a life is to stop to look around… Sometimes having a life is to have a purpose… Sometimes having a life is to move with the punches life is throwing at you… Sometimes having a life is to go through ups and downs like a sinusoidal wave… Before throwing more bullshit around through your self involved life that he/she has no life, walk in their shoes, know them before you make a snap judgment, as you do with your parents.

Have been hearing this new term being used by millennials these days.
Which is having a life or not.

According to which anyone who is not an extrovert and doesn’t like to socialize much doesn’t have a life.

Coming from my own experience, I have shifted base in more than 6 cities in the past 14 years.

Had learned all kind of sports when I first left my home for boarding school, came face to face with discipline and ragging, learned survival saw humble tribal people break coconuts with their head in front of the whole school which was a different kind of joy.

Watched first-day first show and repeat for a week, did numerous night outs with friends to play games while preparing for the most rigorous entrance examination in India.

Hit on random DU girls during cultural meets, toyed with institute computer labs, broke a lot of rules while in college.

While working in my first job and separated with most of my friends, made new friends expanded the variety of people in my network, went on with impulsive trips and jumped together in a newfound lake

On getting transferred to another city with awesome weather, having to start over once again, it hit me for the first time that how increasingly difficult it becomes to make new friends when you grow older
Nevertheless, I traveled and explored parts of the city, exploring all kind of music this multi-ethnic city has to offer, mostly alone if I have to.

But more importantly, I realized.

Having a life doesn’t always mean to booze and party and repeat…

Sometimes having a life is to stop to look around…

Sometimes having a life is to have a purpose…

Sometimes having a life is to move with the punches life is throwing at you…

Sometimes having a life is to go through ups and downs like a sinusoidal wave…

Sometimes it is

Stopping to look around at people or other living beings…

Stopping is to appreciate their needs…

Stopping to take cues from someone that they might need your favorite white jacket more than you, and the joy in giving is not like anything you experienced…

Or sometimes they just need a simple pat to lift themselves up or just a company in the darkness they sit in afraid to go outside into the light…

Or they just need your fav parle-g biscuit to feed their puppies.

Before throwing more bullshit around through your self involved life that he/she has no life, walk in their shoes, know them before you make a snap judgment, as you do with your parents.

You don’t go around proclaiming that your parents have no life because you know the struggles and sacrifices they did for you.

What if they have done the same for wrong people over and over and over again because that’s how they are…

Try to know them, their past their history, knowing that the person might not add anything positive in your life as your parents did, but trust me from my own experience they will when you would least expect it…

Over the years they must have made a lot of meaningful connections like you have right now and might have to watch those connections become meaningless…

Just like how leaves fall during fall…

Posting every second of your life is not equivalent to having a life, it only shows how much an attention seeker you are…

But who am I to say anything as to how one should live their life…

I won’t do anything to your ignorance but to be fair, I will give you a hint…

Give you a hint as you gave me a hint…

While I write this post in my favorite cafe…

Because everything apart, ignorance is still a bliss…

I will keep on exploring the world in my own way while you will in your own way…

But I won’t go down to your level as to say…

You have no life…

Because each and every breath you take and each and every pump your heart make….

Is a proof that you do…

Have a life…

PS: I am complicated, and I know it

entry.title: A Startup Of Startup Winters
entry.content:
Adaptability, perseverance, hard work, customer satisfaction were the topics being discussed every day which have been left out in the glamour of exponential growth, momentum, and exposure during summers of 13-15.

News of Companies getting shut down and employees released was no news at all in this startup winter.

A blessing in disguise it is.

When life gives you lemons you make lemonades, however, there were lemons but no water to make lemonade. 😐

The most chaotic situation a startup can face is imminent changes to the Indian economy, demonetization, and lack of external funds, resources or support.

however creativity is only born in chaos, it is only sustained in lack of stability, it is only valued in the absence of security.

Something unique can only come out of this chaos, as life came into existence through numerous chaotic possibilities.

Adaptability, perseverance, hard work, customer satisfaction were the topics being discussed every day which have been left out in the glamour of exponential growth, momentum, and exposure during summers of 13-15.

News of Companies getting shut down and employees released was no news at all in this startup winter.

Even unicorns felt its heat or lack of heat. 😛

And baby cockroaches were devoured and hunted by this winter even before they were able to grow.

Discussions on revenue rather than a 10x return based on user acquisition were what investors and startup pandits were looking for.

What it showed to young entrepreneurs was a lesson worth it,

That old saying of the customer is always right is in fact true.

That is treating your employees with respect and dignity is a must.

Treating people as people rather than machines is a must.

Excellence is something to thrive for rather than exposure and glamour.

That starting up is something more than a startup, something closer to running a business.

That early adopters of startup summers are as much flawed and imperfect as we are.

That an enterprise is for the people, by the people and its foundations are its building blocks.

That when life punches you hard on your face, you have to stay strong and pull your team up along with you.

That a leader is not someone who is invulnerable he/she can also be knocked off with one hard punch too….

But a good leader is someone who keeps walking or even crawling to motivate his/her followers to do the same and together become a support system for each other.

That support is by your team rather than an enormous amount of funds you raise.

That is sometimes waiting to think about what should be the next steps is more critical than plunging into the first idea or opportunity one can see. 🙂

entry.title: A Memory With A Hockey Team
entry.content:
Metro train was quite empty opposed to general peak time crowd, and quite many of seats were empty, so I sat on an empty bench.

On one of the many metro stations in between a team of hockey players came in a group, men and women included with their hockey kits.

So here it starts.

While I was living in Gurgaon and like any Delhi NCR resident, I take great pride in traveling in India’s one the best public commute system that is Delhi metro.

On one of those days, I was randomly traveling from a metro station to my destination (can’t remember which… too long since it has happened).

Metro train was quite empty opposed to general peak time crowd, and quite many of seats were empty, so I sat on an empty bench.

On one of the many metro stations in between a team of hockey players came in a group, men and women included with their hockey kits.

It was quite apparent they all were Haryanavi Jatts 🙂

One of the girls sat just beside me, she was quite conscious of her body language.

After some time train started to fill up until a point that not a single seat was empty.

A guy came and asked me to make some room between her and me so he can sit in between, he was quite older to both of us.

And all the men in the hockey team were standing near the gate (They didn’t sit even if there were empty seats, taking pride in standing) laughing and chatting in their own unique, hilarious way of Jatts. 🙂

I tried to warn the guy asking for a seat between to remain silent and just leave and stand somewhere else, he keeps on persisting to make space, digging his own hole to die.

I looked towards the leader of their team, and he signaled me to hold my ground and keep sitting.

He again egoistically and proudly asked me to make room for him (You know thoda adjust to chalta hai).

This time the leader spoke and signaling his hands towards his own thighs told the ignorant guy to sit on his lap. (Ae baawli pooch aaja idhar baith ja)

All the girls/women and men started laughing, and the guy had to leave all red in anger.

This is what you call haryanavi blood (like my mom has in hers).

They can quickly teach you lessons by breaking all your bones and spilling your blood using their hockey unless you learn your lessons only by words.

Remember to never mess with a haryanavi. I would definitely not. 😐

PS: Watching dangal with my flatmate sure bring unexpected result in the form of memory long forgotten.

entry.title: A Memory With The Sun
entry.content:
There is a random memory that comes on the surface once in a while about my childhood, where my mom who is always a significant source of teachings and motivation, taught me that /Idiom.

I couldnt understand the point and teaching behind that idiom back then and after few attempts and arguing I gave up on discussing it with my mom, being a thoughtless child to think about something else that may interest me.

Heya,

Before I start lemme build a small background about what I am gonna cover in this post.

So there is a popular saying in Hindi such as “चढ़ते सूरज को सब सलाम करते है !”

Which transform into English idiom: Worshippers of the rising sun.

Meaning

To be with the successful.

There is a random memory that comes on the surface once in a while about my childhood, where my mom who is always a significant source of teachings and motivation, taught me that मुहावरा/Idiom.

Me being a thoughtless child questioned and argued with her No.

डूबता सूरज को सब सलाम करते ह ै! – Worshipping the sun when its set.

I even gave a reason as to why it is true since our sun has given us all the light and life for that whole day, we should be grateful for it when it sets.

Ohh Almighty Sun, you have done your purpose today.

I couldn’t understand the point and teaching behind that idiom back then and after few attempts and arguing I gave up on discussing it with my mom, being a thoughtless child to think about something else that may interest me.

It is only when I have grown up and saw the real world on and about the first time I tasted a small success after school, I get to understand the deep meaning behind that phrase.

We humans never learn from our mistakes, we tag along to causes and people who are on rising like mad and crazy worshippers or भक्त and start thrashing the same cause and people when we see them going downwards or setting to prepare for a new rise next day.

Be its cricket team, dictators, politicians, actors or businessman.

The recent thing I can think of is that of Flipkart and Ola and the public thrashing they are enduring.

Let’s be grateful to that fact that Flipkart is the one and the sole company which can be attributed to preparing the Indian market to accept online payments, to build trust that what you order will be delivered at your doorsteps. It takes a small amount of effort to grow on something that has already been started. But a lot to go against the tides.

I am not a fan of the current way they are doing things and wasn’t for few things they did before.

But in the end we all are humans, and we make mistakes. And I hope we will learn from our mistakes someday and evolve together as a society to reach new heights, else extinction is inevitable.

Only those who have achieved the highest and purest self of themselves being in this world have the privilege to call out to this world I was destined to be here not before not after just at that moment of infinite resourcefulness that particular person has experienced.

Once we have reached your dreams can you say we were destined to be here not before? Till then work hard to achieve your goals.

I promised to take you all on a hell of a ride, but I failed its only part one of my views and conclusion of destiny in a very shallow philosophical manner.

The other part is too complicated and weird for one to understand.

Watch out for part two again when I feel the motivation to pull this topic again.

Sneak peek … karma, sufferings, how destiny is decided for a particular person, why some people don’t pay for their evil deeds and some always end up, and its relation with the formation of destiny.

PS: Ahah! Moment for me yesternight.

A flashback behind the conclusion I made about destiny hit me today. It was in a second year sitting inside the computer lab playing some stupid MMORPG game.

entry.title: The One With A Dad And Son
entry.content:
Out of the blue, I heard a noisy disturbance of a scooter on having a look found a dad driving a scooter with his son standing on the space between the seat and handle, and rushing to another end of the long road in a zig-zag manner but the funny part is the boy and his smile On each cross of roads, dad was blowing horns as to announce the world get away worldly troubles my son is laughing.

Heya,

Night time

Sitting in the balcony, in my own thoughts of solitude yeah it’s scary sometimes to imagine how can someone spend so much time alone, 😐

Out of the blue, I heard a noisy disturbance of a scooter on having a look found a dad driving a scooter with his son standing on the space between the seat and handle, and rushing to another end of the long road in a zig-zag manner but the funny part is the boy and his smile

he was an average child with specs and thin body type and was laughing his ass out in the process.

On each cross of roads, dad was blowing horns as to announce the world get away worldly troubles my son is laughing.

I remember riding on my papa’s scooter when he used to do the same all around our locality and hating why did he always put me in that position, I wanted to ride one, being a free spirit… lol, stupid kid.

I even remember saying once in front of my cousin Arru didi in Bangalore.. jab main scooter chalayunga to papa ko aage khada karunga 😐

Then motorcycle came yet the same story. All I got was a good bicycle to tame. stupidity and Responsibility can’t go hands in hands 😦 🙂

From whence I was adolescence whenever I used to come to home after JEE dad persisted me to learn, I learned half-heartedly but did learn. Finally, after college with a brand new bike, I could make that dream come true.

And I am sure my dad will be the one to teach me how to drive a car someday now when we have one waiting to test my hands at home so that eventually I can do the same for my future generation.

Its silly to see cues in these little things but that makes me understand the meaning of life.

Creation of life, growth and maybe someday far destruction 😦

For me past is not something to frown upon it is the mirror to acceptance and change.

Forgetting past may spare one happiness, but it definitely will take away the chance of achieving content. Inner peace.

Thanking all ohh hail forces of nature and

Special thanks to you for making me realize, this simple yet essential truth 🙂

for now

bye

entry.title: What Birth Is?
entry.content:
Ohh its a hypothetical particle which explains space is not empty and instead of a fluid or ocean of Higgs boson particles which provide matter its mass…

It has been known for the past few decades that our universe is made up of something weird called dark matter and dark energy..?

Heya,

Its a far more difficult topic to write than any of previous I wrote, however, let’s give it a try.. it’s going to be a long shot but worth the shot

before understanding birth, we should understand death..!!

Something doesn’t seem right? Does death come after birth?

exactly till birth to death, we have observations but what about from death to birth.

It would be nice for me to read my first post of what death is? Before I start on birth.

I don’t know exactly where to start from so much to write concisely.

Ok, I was always a prominent skeptic about rebirth and reincarnations or any of the theory be it religious or scientific however now all my thought experiments are pointing towards them.

Let’s take that from religious as well as scientific POV and then maybe nature can instill some insights.

Last thing first..

Nature

We all can sense there are three forces that define it, each and everyday events oscillate around these three.

Creation, Growth, and Destruction.

The same entity or object or person or anything we know can be oscillated or manipulated or constructed to these characteristics,
Like for example, thoughts are creative or supporting growth or destructive. Nuclear force can be used to create, sustain civilizations or destroy. Same goes for people.

OSCILLATIONS

Creation and growth evolve together while destruction work opposite to them 😉 its not a bad thing it is how it is. None is right none is wrong.

So that means after destruction creation can take place? 😐

Oscillations go to string theory…

Science

Now science comes into the picture.

There is a big buzz around Higgs boson or God particle and building of a large particle collider. Michio Kaku is the guy behind string theory.

According to which every force or every energy or every particle can be understood as if at the core of the musical strings are oscillating on different notes each note changing the nature to something else.. be it an electron, proton.. be it gravitational, electro-magnetism force.

A real genius he is.. celebrating his birthday tomorrow 🙂 waiting for detection of sparticles (super particles) to test his theory in the same CERN particle collider, hope he succeeds. 😐

However, what about god’s particle or Higgs boson…

Ohh it’s a hypothetical particle which explains space is not empty and instead of a fluid or ocean of Higgs boson particles which provide matter its mass…

The more difficult for a matter to pass through this ocean the more drag it feels, the more mass it gains… WoW, let me read my post what past is? again 🙂

It has been known for the past few decades that our universe is made up of something weird called dark matter and dark energy..? seriously? When I first found out, I said come on give it a better name. 😦

Well they can’t be detected directly, they don’t interact with matter, or light particles so can’t be observed yet we sense them as ghosts of our universe because they do have mass and consists about 96% of the universe. Did I say ghosts?

Moreover, there is some dark energy which is pushing everything away from each other hence we hear universe is expanding.. but what exactly can this dark energy be?

I believe its soul energy which is contrary to its name given we all must already have a preconception of something dark about this energy 😦 😦 maybe scary Ghosts. 😐

let me explain how I believe that.

Religion

Religion came into the rescue...

Tell me what you know about the soul or maybe heard from our ancestors or TV etc.

Well they are inside us… however, where exactly we don’t know for sure

we don’t know where it comes from what is its nature, characteristics

well, they don’t interact with our body but drive our body…

they do have some mass.. again controversial by some experiments on glass fitted dying body… damn these crazy scientists 😐

now think about whatever I said about dark energy.. everything matches?

Going by the concept of moksha when a body attains it, the soul becomes eternal it doesn’t have to take rebirth into a body. According to this and Kalki Puran as kalyug goes by more and more soul are united with God before destruction.

That means dark energy if it is genuinely soul energy will increase over time.

Which is a doubt in the scientific community whether dark energy remains the same or increase with time.

If it remains the same universe will expand into nothingness and if it increases then.

one day one moment every possible atom or matter will explode into destruction.

Hmm thinking it by this way makes me feel we are doomed for destruction. I may be wrong everything I concluded is wishful and dreamy with little proof.

However, hey I am not here to entertain your every doubt on me or my theories.

Moreover, here is a bonus…

Realistic speaking there are instances in history where people can recall their past lives there are a whole lot of articles and documentary on youtube and net, the biggest one is Reincarnation of Anne Frank after around 30 years or something as I remember.

By Hindu mythology, the nature of one true God can’t be known or understood which I got to know is according to Hinduism reading some posts on quora .. dammit I came to this conclusion way before these gitas and sitas.

Anyways for all those feminists out there who says there are no women in the three Gods of creation, growth, and destruction… Brahma, Vishnu, Mahesh

I believe society has hidden a long forgotten truth in that. The majority are feminine out of these three Gods of nature or gatekeepers who are ordinary souls but evolved to such extent to be idolized as Gods.

It’s your job to figure which two out of three are if you are worthy to know as a feminine.

haha just gone through some not my jobs memes. 😛 🙂

Another thought which I discovered recently is a bit related to the above concept. there is no such thing as karma or getting bad for evil deeds and good for good

u get what u desire in the last moments of your death before rebirth u get a choice every day every moment to change your far (rebirth) and near future (present life).

PS: I am not over analyzing things don’t want to put any constraint on the ideas as opposed to what society tries to, who r they to tell us how everything works here. We all must have heard about the famous monkey shower experiment. We don’t need anyone’s approval to think and do things we feel like to. On the downside, too much of that is terrible. Balance is what we should seek…

repeat with me .. I am an individual independent citizen of society who has every bit of right to question social reforms for our betterment.

Screw them…

repeat with me .. I love and care about society until unless it doesn’t try to change me.

Screw you guys I am going home 😛 and if nothing makes sense screw me too… Huh?

PPS: Here is a video by Michio Kaku on consciousness how to define it and measure it

video

Watch out for physics girl and her website believed to be next Einstein by Harvard.

PPS: Life has retaken an exciting turn, working on an idea I believe is the next big thing, taking up to read the brave new world, just got my elements cube after 3 months of waiting for delivery. Its winters.. time to hibernate 😐

bye

for now 😐

entry.content:
He said haan, took a chai although I rarely like to drink chai voluntarily Then a carwala and then a bikewala came for chai and cigarettes, waited for them to go.

Sipping my chai slowly, the reason?? haan abhi to yaha pe lagana shuru kiya hai to jyada log nahi jaante, agar jyada log nahi aate to dusre signal me chale jate hain. aap yahan ke to nahi lagte aapki hindi achhi hai..

Ohh the Night and the long rides, some part of all of us loves that.. either reacted with great company or serenity of our own minds.

while one of those bike rides, I came across a chaiwala on sidelines of a highway.

when I lazily saw a guy standing by his bicycle with a big bottle of milton tea, the way his expectant eyes were seeing me made me stop and look what life has to offer.

when asked aapke paas chai hai?

he said haan, took a chai although I rarely like to drink chai voluntarily (burns ur tongue dammit)

Then a carwala and then a bikewala came for chai and cigarettes, waited for them to go.

sipping my chai slowly, the reason??

A sense of innocence and not belonging to the city.

After the others are gone, silence is broken.

Aap roj aate ho yahan raat me?

haan

roj raat me 11-12 baje?

haan abhi to yaha pe lagana shuru kiya hai to jyada log nahi jaante, agar jyada log nahi aate to dusre signal me chale jate hain.

aap yahan ke to nahi lagte aapki hindi achhi hai..

He agreed and said in dis encouraging voice UP.

sahi main bhi UP ka hun, aisa kuch nhi hai 🙂

aapki family wahi pe?

haan hum abhi aaye hai yahan 2-3 mahine hue hai.

Gosh smile is so contagious. 🙂

after the payment of overpriced “8 rupees” chai, I started off on my bike but happened to forget my key to the lock of the seat, when searching for it he told its there only.

A thanks bhaiya and I am off.

On my way, I imagined how he must have come from somewhere to establish him in this city.

Maybe by his advisories, he got to know the need of chai sutta chronicle in the city who does sleep. 🙂

Don’t know about him but I have got my chai sutta chronicle tonight. 😐

entry.title: What Love Is?
entry.content:
Its the last day for your relationship with any particular person You become a person with whom the concerned person will always have something to take advantage of You become a person, being with whom always suits them You become that person according to the needs of the concerned person like money, emotional stability, sex anything and then People always say mothers love is the purest form of love

A Harsh truth –
“What suits you hurts you.”

People come to your life when it suits them.

They love you when it suits them.

They hurt you when it suits them.

They leave you when it suits them.

If you want to prevent yourself from being hurt then
either you accept the fact and live each day of your life as if
its the last day for your relationship with any particular person
and be on constant watch that he/she may hurt you and leave you
which is a sad choice of course

or you take another sad choice where
you become a person with whom the concerned person will always have something to take advantage of
you become a person, being with whom always suits them
and you become that person according to the needs of the concerned person like money, emotional stability, sex anything and then

you lose ur identity

People always say mothers love is the purest form of love
I agree with it a bit .. not wholly
The purest form of love is that of mother and child
because the child is the only true being, the only innocent human being who is unaltered by this harsh reality of life

and a child love for you is the best gift you can get

We have numerous examples in history where two children fall in love, and then they try to fight the world for their love even when they are separated for years, e.g., Romeo Juliet, Heer Ranjha, Devdas 😉
Why so? Because that is innocent love…

love when you don’t even know the meaning of what suits you is

PS: The first blog entry post I wrote around a year and a half ago 🙂

PPS: Just being a dreamer and delusional as I always am 😐

entry.title: What Hope Is?
entry.content:
Hope is something when we believe some event has a probability of happening in near or distant future and acknowledging side by side that It may not happen at all, When reality rears its ugly head, and we accept that the thing we were hoping and expecting didnt happen it leads to big disappointment, and…

One of the best lessons I learned about hope from my encounter with a beautiful person is about Hope.

Hope is a very tricky thing we all humans possess.

Let’s start with understanding when and why we hope.

we all are unsatisfied with something or other at every point of our life.

The greater the fear and confusion the greater we hope.

however, hope leads to expectations which lead to disappointment right?

we will see if the above statement is correct

hope is something when we believe some event has a probability of happening in near or distant future and acknowledging side by side that It may not happen at all,

that there is very little chance, the thing we are hoping can happen

while the expectation is defined as believing that even if there is a slight chance, it will happen.

and when reality rears its ugly head, and we accept that the thing we were hoping and expecting didn’t happen it leads to big disappointment, and…

we lose our faith on hope.

So the only way to retain our faith on hope is to hope but not expecting anything at all.

however simple the above statement seems it is the most difficult thing to practice,

to keep away expectations from hope is to keep away two people with one soul 😉

It’s painful, and it’s awful.

so the next time u hope something starts practicing this question.

What I am expecting is it feasible, is it actually probable and possible.

To keep the heart unwrinkled, to be hopeful, kindly, cheerful, and reverent: that is the triumph over old age.

Thomas Aldrich

entry.title: What Past Is?
entry.content:
In that lecture, our professor was teaching us how a ball experience greater force while traveling in a viscous fluid.

The higher the viscosity of fluid its traveling in, the higher the drag, the rougher the surface of the ball, the more drag it experiences.

Suppose you are the ball traveling in the flow of life and the fluid is your experience in it.

I was a chemical engineer once, and the only worthwhile lesson I learned from one of my boring lectures was on past

In that lecture, our professor was teaching us how a ball experience greater force while traveling in a viscous fluid.

with some formulas of course 😉

which is called drag.

The higher the viscosity of fluid it’s traveling in, the higher the drag, the rougher the surface of the ball, the more drag it experiences.

coming back to what past is?

suppose you are the ball traveling in the flow of life and the fluid is your experience in it.

the more difficult ur life is the more drag u face

sometimes it drags u behind, sometimes it stops you

sometimes it let u pass without any resistance

hence proved

Past is a Drag

however, does that mean we should avoid it?

never

the more u try to resist ur past the more drag u will experience like a rough ball faces

Only when u have come to a free-flowing life, u will miss the struggle u faced and came out as a winner

Only when u have learned how to avoid the drag by being a smooth ball

u will get the strength to face another drag of the universally resented past.

PS: Watching friends and listening to some touching songs sure bring unexpected results from my subconscious mind taking the form of a memory long forgotten. 😐
